property.description: The name of the property that will be checked. Examples are `facing` or `age`. See: [Minecraft Wiki: Block States (List of block states)](https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/block_condition_types/block_state)
property.markdownDescription: The name of the property that will be checked. Examples are `facing` or `age`. See: [Minecraft Wiki: Block States (List of block states)](https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/block_condition_types/block_state)

comparison.description: If specified, determines how the specified property will be compared to a specified value. If not and the property is an integer, it will just check if the block has the specified property.
comparison.markdownDescription: If specified, determines how the specified property will be compared to a specified value. If not and the property is an integer, it will just check if the block has the specified property.

compare_to.description: If specified, the value to compare to the value of the specified property.
compare_to.markdownDescription: If specified, the value to compare to the value of the specified property.

value.description: If specified, the boolean to compare to the value of the specified property if the specified property is a boolean.
value.markdownDescription: If specified, the boolean to compare to the value of the specified property if the specified property is a boolean.

enum.description: If specified, the string to compare to the specified property if the specified property is a string.
enum.markdownDescription: If specified, the string to compare to the specified property if the specified property is a string.

type.description:
## Block State

---



[Block Condition Type](https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/block_condition_types/block_state)

Checks a block state property of the block.  Depending on the property type, different values are expected: boolean properties use `value`, enumeration properties use `enum`, and integer properties use `comparison` and `compare_to`.

Type ID: `origins:block_state`



---

### üìù Note

If none of the expected fields are specified, this condition will just check if the block has the specified property.






---

### Examples

```json
"block_condition": {
    "type": "origins:and",
    "conditions": [
        {
            "type": "origins:block",
            "block": "minecraft:chest"
        },
        {
            "type": "origins:block_state",
            "property": "facing",
            "enum": "north"
        }
    ]
}
```

This example will check if a Chest block is facing north.

```json
"block_condition": {
	"type": "origins:block_state",
	"property": "age"
}
```

This example will check if the specified block has the `age` Block State property.
type.markdownDescription:
undefined## Block State

---



[Block Condition Type](https://origins.readthedocs.io/en/latest/types/block_condition_types/block_state)

Checks a block state property of the block.  Depending on the property type, different values are expected: boolean properties use `value`, enumeration properties use `enum`, and integer properties use `comparison` and `compare_to`.

Type ID: `origins:block_state`



---

### üìù Note

If none of the expected fields are specified, this condition will just check if the block has the specified property.






---

### Examples

```json
"block_condition": {
    "type": "origins:and",
    "conditions": [
        {
            "type": "origins:block",
            "block": "minecraft:chest"
        },
        {
            "type": "origins:block_state",
            "property": "facing",
            "enum": "north"
        }
    ]
}
```

This example will check if a Chest block is facing north.

```json
"block_condition": {
	"type": "origins:block_state",
	"property": "age"
}
```

This example will check if the specified block has the `age` Block State property.
